project_abstract.cdata: The Cultural Heritage Project is to help Romania develop an improved national cultural heritage strategy that will preserve priority cultural heritage sites/assets by testing different partnership approaches with a view to improving overall management in a more sustainable, cost-effective manner. The project consists of four components. 1) The first component will support the renovation and restoration of the internationally acclaimed Brancusi Sculptural Ensemble. 2) The second component will help a) complete restoration of the 18th century Brancovan Palace at Mogosoaia; and b) finance emergency repairs and prepare a site development and management plan and community support program for a second Brancovan palace at Potlogi. 3) The third component will support a program to test pilot efforts in selected historic Saxon Villages in the central Transylvania region to determine options for sustaining cultural preservation and promoting social and inter-cultural cohesion. 4) The last component will assist institutional strengthening involving a) capacity building in the new project management unit in the Ministry of Culture; b) formulation of an long-term national cultural heritage partnership strategy; c) feasibility studies to determine the appropriate use of the new building for the National Library in Bucharest; and d) public information and awareness-raising campaign to build stronger civic understanding of the importance of cultural heritage.
